page.title: 03PLACE NAMES 1
page.content: A{Sike}is old English for the drainage of a marsh.Later use of the word is used to describe a furrow which drained land.A{Common}is an area of unenclosed land which could be used by local residents. Thus this name probably means the drainage ditch of the common land. A{Crag}is a cliff or rocky place so this pond is probably the pond near a crag. The word{Beck},meaning brook or stream and comes from the Norse word 'Bekka'. This stream could be named 'Crook' because it is winding and crooked. {'Dam Bridge}' is self explanatory.It is the bridge near the dam. Lartington is an old name which is shown by the '_ing' component.In the {'Domesday Book'}of 1086{Lartington}was
